occupation: Business Partnerships Senior Manager @ Per Scholas | Technical Career Advisor | RBS Student & Freelance Photographer
headline: Business Partnerships Senior Manager @ Per Scholas | Technical Career Advisor | RBS Student & Freelance Photographer
summary:
Hello! I'm Naomi Betancourt and I am currently a full-time Partnerships Manager at Per Scholas, part-time Rutgers Business student, and a freelance fashion photographer! My career is mixed with a technical, analytical, and creative background. 

I am eager to contribute to my community by working in a role that involves teaching and assisting individuals in underserved areas. I am committed to providing my community with the necessary knowledge and resources to improve the skills of my loved ones and acquaintances. I find it fulfilling to work in both corporate and nonprofit sectors because it allows me to demonstrate the potential for career growth with my current experience. I place a high value on being a valuable asset to my team and potentially leading my team to expand the support we offer. Additionally, I am attentive to details and able to identify steps to minimize risks and enhance efficiency.

As a former volunteer for the Alumni Board Committee of Year Up, I served as the Board Chair and had a team of four members. It was my first experience in a role that involved handling a business credit card for event expenses. To ensure smooth communication and coordination among the team, I created a community hub system on Notion that notified the members about new meetings, event planning, financial coordination, and resource channels. Together with my team, we successfully planned and managed four events, with their assistance in the Marketing, Operations, and Finance areas. I conducted biweekly meetings to review our progress, assess our strengths and weaknesses for the month, share new ideas for upcoming events, and celebrate our achievements.

Skills: Partnerships Relationships, Active Listening, Data Visualization, Performance Metrics, Negotiations, Stakeholder Management, Career Advancement, Detailed Oriented, Professional Development, Report Writing, Conflict Management

experiences.title: Founder
experiences.location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

experiences.title: Business Partnerships Manager
experiences.description:
The Business Solutions team coordinates with Per Scholas local and national resources to identify, develop and cultivate relationships with new and existing corporate employer partners to place successful graduates in jobs with them and create hiring pipelines for our graduates.

• Responsible to provide business insights and may detect problems in almost any aspect of a business, including data management processes & organizational strategies 
• Assist in increasing 12-month job attainment for our graduates by 30% in 2022 by cultivating and engaging with existing and new partnerships and providing career support and interview preparation 
• Manage the interview and placement processes for our learners with our corporate partners
• Identify student needs and provide necessary resources, work with individualized career plans, and support addressing student behavior or attitude concerns to prepare students for entry to mid-level careers in technology
• Provide students with individual career counseling and employment preparation coaching, as needed, and recommend students for particular employment opportunities
• Connect graduates with the resources necessary for them to maintain employment to upskill alumni careers and career development
• Monitor and manage student outcome and placement data in Per Scholas Salesforce database as well as up-and-out metrics for internal and client reporting
• Develop a strong network of local employers to support job placement of graduates and establish a voice in workforce development
• Align the career development strategy with Per Scholas client requirements
• Co-manage alumni outreach and activities for students graduating from Per Scholas programs with event coordinating, market researching, and developing new solutions for market growth 
• Creating and presenting visually appealing business and educational presentations

Softwares/Tools: Microsoft Excel, Salesforce, HubSpot, AirTable, Google Suites

experiences.title: Alumni Board Chairperson

experiences.title: Supplier Diversity Apprentice
experiences.description:
S&P Global has recently launched the Supplier Diversity Program. The goal is to implement and enhance the S&Ps Supplier Diversity Program. This includes developing policies procedures, objectives, processes, and communications. 

• Support and assist in the development of presentation and reports, both internal and external
• Help implement new and innovative methods to identify and qualify diverse supplier candidates
• Identify and help implement opportunities to make it simple for diverse suppliers to apply/qualify/partner with S&P
• Support efforts to build relationships with local and regional diversity council organizations including NMSDC, WBENC, NaVOBA, Disability:IN, ByBlack
• Coordinate event schedules and the participation of other S&P employees and Business Units (e.g., matchmaking events to identify qualified candidates)
• Assist in promoting S&P in the Supplier Diversity community
• Assist in conducting Supplier Diversity related training sessions to internal and external stakeholders

Softwares: Asana, Smartsheet, Microsoft Office, Tealbook, Supplier.io

recommendations:
Fatim C.



Having managed Naomi for a few months, I am thoroughly impressed by her dedication and exceptional contributions to our team. Her passion for fostering a thriving tech workforce in Newark is evident in her coaching and the robust employer pathways she creates. Naomi's sharp insight, creativity, and commitment to excellence have significantly improved our team projects. I'm super thankful to have her on our team!

Kelsey Briggs-Dineen



Naomi is a consistent resource to all those who work with her.  Her passion and motivation to grow a healthy tech workforce in Newark can be seen in the individuals she coaches, the employer pathways she creates, and the clear SOPs she creates to guide future colleagues.  I'm thankful to have her on our team!
